model

Class MSC

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.MSC

  • public class MSC
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MSC()
      Constructor that initializes three arrays: users, songs and playlists and three attributes for the total amount of users, songs and playlists in the MSC

      • spaceAvailableUser

        public boolean spaceAvailableUser()
        Method that checks if there's space for more users
        Returns:
        true if there's space, otherwise false

      • spaceAvailableSong

        Method that checks if there's space for more songs
        Returns:
        true if there's space, otherwise false

        Method that checks if there's space for more playlists
        Returns:
        true if there's space, otherwise false

      • getPlaylist

        public Playlist getPlaylist(int index)
        Method that returns a specific playlist of the playlists array
        Parameters:
        index - it's the position where the asked playlist is
        Returns:
        playlists[index] the playlist in the given position

      • getUser

        public User getUser(int index)
        Method that returns a specific user of the array users
        Parameters:
        index - index it's the position where the asked user is
        Returns:
        users[index] the user in the given position

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String nickname,
                    java.lang.String password,
                    int age,
                    int uploadedSongs)
        Method that adds a new user
        pre: array users is initialized. There isn't another user with the same nickname. There are empty indexes
        pos: numUsers++, users has a new object in the first empty index found
        Parameters:
        nickname - is the identifier for the user. nickname !=null . nickname!= ""
        password - user's password. password != null. password != ""
        age - the user's age. age>0
        uploadedSongs - is the quantity of songs uploaded to the pool, by default it starts in 0

      • addSong

        public void addSong(java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String artist,
                    java.lang.String releaseDate,
                    java.lang.String duration,
                    java.lang.String genre)
        Method that adds a new song to the pool
        pre: array songs is initialized. There isn't another song with the same title. There are empty indexes
        pos: numSongs++, songs has a new object in the first empty index found
        Parameters:
        title - is the name of the song. title !=null . title!= ""
        artist - is the name of the perfomer of the song. artist !=null . artist!= ""
        releaseDate - is the release date of the song in format DD/MM/YYYY. releaseDate != null. releaseDate != ""
        duration - is the duration of the song in format HH:MM:SS. duration!=null, duration!=""
        genre - is the genre which the song belongs to, it's one the options in Genre class

      • addPublicPlaylist

        public void addPublicPlaylist(java.lang.String name)
        Method that adds a public playlist
        pre: playlists array is initialized. There isn't another playlist with the same name. There are empty indexes
        pos: numPlaylists++, playlists has a new object of PublicPlaylist type in the first empty index found
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the playlist. title !=null . title!= ""

      • addPrivatePlaylist

        public void addPrivatePlaylist(java.lang.String name,
                               int userIndex)
        Method that adds a private playlist
        pre: playlists array is initialized. There isn't another playlist with the same name. There are empty indexes
        pos: numPlaylists++, playlists has a new object of PrivatePlaylist type in the first empty index found
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the playlist. title !=null . title!= ""
        userIndex - is the position in the array users where the authorized user is. userIndex ≥ 0

      • addRestrictedPlaylist

        public void addRestrictedPlaylist(java.lang.String name,
                                  int userIndex)
        Method that adds a restricted playlist
        pre: playlists array is initialized. There isn't another playlist with the same name. There are empty indexes
        pos: numPlaylists++, playlists has a new object of PrivatePlaylist type in the first empty index found
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the playlist. title !=null . title!= ""
        userIndex - is the position in the array users where the main authorized user is . userIndex ≥ 0

      • addAuthorizedUserRestricted

        public void addAuthorizedUserRestricted(int playlistPosition,
                                        int userIndex)
        Method that adds a new authorized user to a restricted playlist
        pre: playlists array and users are initialized. The playlist and the user exist. The new user isn't an authorized user yet. There's space for new authorized users
        pos:
        Parameters:
        playlistPosition - is the position in the playlists array where the given playlist is. playlistPosition ≥ 0
        userIndex - is the position in the array users where the new authorized user is. userIndex > 0

      • findAuthorizedUser

        public boolean findAuthorizedUser(java.lang.String nickname,
                                  int position)
        Method that checks if the given user is an authorized user in a restricted playlist
        pre: playlists array is initialized. The playlist and the user exist. The playlist is indeed restricted
        pos:
        Parameters:
        nickname - is user's nickname to check existence. nickname!=null. nickname!=""
        position - is the position in the playlists array where the playlist to be consulted is. userIndex > 0
        Returns:
        found which is true if the user is one of the authorized users and false if it isn't

      • availableAuthorizedUsers

        public boolean availableAuthorizedUsers(int playlistIndex)
        Method that checks if a restricted playlist has space for new authorized users
        pre: playlists array is initialized. The playlist exist. The playlist is indeed restricted
        pos:
        Parameters:
        playlistIndex - is the position in the playlists array where the playlist is. playlistIndex ≥0
        Returns:
        available which is true if there's space, false otherwise

      • checkSong

        public boolean checkSong(int playlistIndex,
                         java.lang.String songName)
        Method that checks if a song already exists in a playlist
        pre: playlists array is initialized. The playlist and the song exist
        pos:
        Parameters:
        playlistIndex - is the position in the playlists array where the playlist is. playlistIndex ≥0
        songName - is the name of the song to be checked. songName!=null. songName!=""
        Returns:
        found which is true if the song is in the playlist, otherwise it's false

      • checkOwner

        public boolean checkOwner(java.lang.String nickname,
                          int position)
        Method that checks if the given user is the authorized user of a private playlist
        pre: playlists array is initialized. The playlist and the user exist. The playlist is indeed private
        pos:
        Parameters:
        nickname - is user's nickname to check. nickname!=null. nickname!=""
        position - is the position in the playlists array where the playlist to be consulted is. userIndex > 0
        Returns:
        owner which is true if the user is the owner and false if it isn't

      • showUsers

        public java.lang.String showUsers()
        showUsers method that returns the information of all the users in the MSC
        Returns:
        usersListInfo, String with all the information

      • findUser

        public int[] findUser(java.lang.String nickname)
        findUser is a method that informs if an user's nickname already exists and in which index is located
        Parameters:
        nickname - is the nickname to look for
        Returns:
        userFoundData it's an array, in its first position it's either 1 or 0. 1 for found, 0 for not found and in it's second position it's the index where the user is found, by default is 0

      • findSong

        public int[] findSong(java.lang.String title)
        findSong is a method that informs if a song's title already exists
        Parameters:
        title - is the song to look for
        Returns:
        songFoundData it's an array, in its first position it's either 1 or 0. 1 for found, 0 for not found and in it's second position it's the index where the song is found, by default is 0

      • findPlaylist

        public int[] findPlaylist(java.lang.String name)
        findPlaylist is a method that informs if a playlist already exists and in which index is located
        Parameters:
        name - is the playlist's name to look for
        Returns:
        playlistFoundData it's an array, in its first position it's either 1 or 0. 1 for found, 0 for not found and in it's second position it's the index where the playlist is found, by default is 0

      • findPlaylistType

        public boolean findPlaylistType(int type,
                                int position)
        findPlaylistType is a method that checks if the given playlist belongs to the given type
        pre: playlists array is initialized. The playlist is already created
        pos:
        Parameters:
        type - is the type to be consulted, it's either 1, 2 or 3. 1 for public. 2 for private and 3 for restricted. type > 0
        position - is the position in the playlists array where the playlist to be consulted is. userIndex > 0
        Returns:
        typeFound if the playlist belongs to the given type it's true, otherwise is false

      • rankPlaylist

        public void rankPlaylist(int playlistIndex,
                         int rank)
        rankPlaylist is a method that gives a public playlist a score
        pre: playlists array is initialized. The playlist is already created. The playlist is indeed public
        pos:
        Parameters:
        playlistIndex - is the position in the playlists array where the playlist is. playlistIndex ≥0
        rank - is the given score. Integer from 1 to 5. rank > 0

      • addSongToPlaylist

        public void addSongToPlaylist(int songIndex,
                              int playlistIndex)
        addSongToPlaylist is a method that adds a song to a playlist
        ; pre: playlists and songs array are initialized. The playlist and the song are already created. The song isn't already in the playlist
        pos:
        Parameters:
        songIndex - is the position in the songs array where the song to be added is. songIndex≥0
        playlistIndex - is the position in the playlists array where the playlist is. playlistIndex≥0

      • showSongs

        public java.lang.String showSongs()
        showSongs method that returns the information of all the songs in the MSC
        Returns:
        songsListInfo, String with all the information

      • showPlaylists

        public java.lang.String showPlaylists()
        showPlaylists method that returns the information of all the playlists in the MSC
        Returns:
        playlistsInfo, String with all the information
